definitions.definition: Authorization or certification; a sanction, as given by a superior.
Something that provides assurance or confirmation; a guarantee or proof.
definitions.example: a warrant of authenticity; a warrant for success

definitions.definition: An order that serves as authorization; especially a voucher authorizing payment or receipt of money.
An option, usually issued together with another security and with a term at issue greater than a year, to buy other securities of the issuer.
A judicial writ authorizing an officer to make a search, seizure, or arrest, or to execute a judgment.
definitions.example: an arrest warrant issued by the court

definitions.definition: A document certifying that a motor vehicle meets certain standards of mechanical soundness and safety; a warrant of fitness.
To give (someone) an assurance or guarantee (of something); also, with a double object: to guarantee (someone something).
To guarantee (something) to be (of a specified quality, value, etc.).
To guarantee as being true; (colloquially) to believe strongly.
definitions.example: That tree is going to fall, I’ll warrant.

definitions.definition: To authorize; to give (someone) sanction or warrant (to do something).
definitions.example: I am warranted to search these premises fully.

definitions.definition: To justify; to give grounds for.
definitions.example: Circumstances arose that warranted the use of lethal force.
